intro: Casearia velutinosa, commonly known as the velvet casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, fragrant yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
